title: Gisèle Pelicot tells BBC: I felt crushed by horror - but I don't feel anger
partialText: In an extensive interview with Newsnight, the woman at the heart of France's biggest rape trial speaks about betrayal, healing and choosing the right path.

title: Watch: 'I am a survivor' Gisèle Pelicot tells BBC Newsnight
partialText: Ms Pelicot reveals it is "inconceivable" that the man she shared her life with "could have committed these horrors".

title: Queen's letter of support left Pelicot 'overwhelmed'
partialText: The Queen's note said Gisèle Pelicot's courage had "created a powerful legacy that will change the narrative around shame, forever".

title: Police activity under way near Nancy Guthrie's home
partialText: A search has been carried out in Tuscon, Arizona, close to where the 84-year-old was abducted from nearly two weeks ago.

title: UK basks in sunshine ahead of snow and ice weather warnings
partialText: After days of cloud and rain, the weekend starts sunny and cold with further snow and ice warnings as Simon King expalains

title: How Matt Weston handled pressure to win gold and GB's first medal
partialText: Matt Weston cements his status as the best skeleton racer in the world, as he makes history in emphatic fashion in Cortina.

title: Shaidorov wins gold as 'Quad God' Malinin crumbles
partialText: Ilia Malinin, the red-hot favourite for men's figure skating gold, suffers a nightmare on the ice.

title: The two Chinese-American Olympians competing for rival superpowers
partialText: Eileen Guo and Alysa Liu have been thrust into a debate that goes far beyond sports.

title: Boxers, dancers and weightlifters - the war dead pictured on banned Ukrainian slider's helmet
partialText: Vladyslav Heraskevych's helmet depicts fellow athletes who have been killed since Russia's full-scale invasion of his country.

title: Why Margot Robbie and Jacob Elordi's 'mutual obsession' is giving some fans the ick
partialText: Romance rumours have swirled around co-stars Margot Robbie and Jacob Elordi. But is all as it seems?

title: She didn't expect to fall in love on ChatGPT - and then have to say goodbye
partialText: Rae began speaking to Barry after a difficult divorce, but Barry lives on an old model of ChatGPT that's being shut down.

title: He was once a teen 'superstar'. Why did James Van Der Beek need help to pay his medical bills?
partialText: A fundraiser was setup to help the actor's family after expensive cancer treatments devastated their finances.

title: Is dining out dying out?
partialText: The restaurant industry says it is facing a double whammy - rising costs and customers with less money.

title: Kenyans drop flowers for Valentine's bouquets of cash. Not everyone is impressed
partialText: Bouquets of cash have been blooming in popularity in Kenya but recent warnings may slow the trend.

title: Time will heal Beckham family relationship, says Gordon Ramsay
partialText: The celebrity chef urged Brooklyn to remember "one day you're not going to have your Mum and Dad", in the wake of a fall out with parents Sir David and Lady Victoria Beckham.

title: The Papers: 'Palestine Action ban ruled unlawful' and 'Matt grabs Olympic gold'
partialText: A number of front pages carry a photo of skeleton racer Matt Weston, who took home Team GB's first 2026 Winter Olympics medal on Friday night.

title: Trump says Iran regime change is 'best thing that could happen'
partialText: The US President's comment comes as a second aircraft carrier heads to the Middle East to pile pressure on Iran.

title: Ros Atkins on... Mandelson and the vetting system
partialText: Revelations over Peter Mandelson’s links to convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein have raised questions about how he became ambassador. Our Analysis Editor Ros Atkins reports.

title: Sister of April Jones 'still waiting to wake up from nightmare' of her murder
partialText: April's disappearance in 2012 sparked the biggest missing person search in UK police history.

title: Two Britons among three dead in French Alps avalanche
partialText: The Britons had been part of a group of five people accompanied by an instructor, skiing off-piste in Val d'Isère.

title: Stroke survivors trial new at-home tech: 'It's given me my freedom back'
partialText: Participants in the NHS 'Triceps' trial wear a device in their ear which emits electrical pulses while they do rehab.

title: Father of Coronation Street star to climb Everest on behalf of son and other deaf children
partialText: Michael Woods says he is inspired by his actor son Joseph, who plays Aled Winter-Brown.

title: Somalian airline praises pilot for crash-landing faulty plane, saving all 55 on board
partialText: All 55 people on board survived after the plane failed to land on the runway near the shoreline.

title: Rare loggerhead turtle washes up on Suffolk beach during storm
partialText: The warm-water turtle is assessed and taken to a specialist centre for treatment.

title: Student beats seven other comedians to be crowned UK's pun champion
partialText: Adam Ernest Pickard beat seven other comedians to claim the 2026 title at the Leicester Comedy Festival.

title: BBC News app
partialText: Top stories, breaking news, live reporting, and follow news topics that match your interests

title: Sir Jim Ratcliffe Says Sorry (To Some) For 'Colonised' Comments
partialText: And an update from Tehran.

title: Has Jeff Bezos brought down the Washington Post?
partialText: The Amazon boss has gutted a third of the workforce at the iconic newspaper

title: England's brave new era runs up against Murrayfield ghosts
partialText: England come in with all the momentum. Scotland arrive chastened. But the recent history of Test rugby's oldest fixture will take some escaping.

title: How Weston handled pressure to win Olympic gold and GB's first medal
partialText: Matt Weston cements his status as the best skeleton racer in the world, making history by winning Olympic gold in emphatic fashion in Cortina and securing Team GB’s first medal of the 2026 Winter Games.

title: 'It was silly from me' - 'brilliant' Delap recovers from error
partialText: Chelsea striker Liam Delap turns in "top" performance in the 4-0 win over Hull City with a hat-trick of assists after missing a sitter.

title: Tucker's 94 keeps Ireland's World Cup hopes alive
partialText: Stand-in captain Lorcan Tucker hits an unbeaten 94 to lead Ireland to a 96-run win over Oman at the T20 World Cup.

title: 'Matt Weston, take a bow!' - Team GB win first medal at 2026 Games
partialText: Matt Weston wins the first medal for Team GB at the 2026 Winter Olympics, taking home the men's skeleton gold at Milan-Cortina.
